text: Morocco will be scheduled to compete in the 2020 Summer Paralympics in Tokyo, Japan from 25 August to 6 September. Morocco will be hosting the first African Para Games in January 2020 which will act as a Games qualifier in some sports. ==Athletics== Three Moroccan athletes (two men, one woman) have automatically qualified in athletics in the World Para Athletics Marathon Championships ;Men's track {|class=wikitable style="font-size:95%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heats !colspan="3"|Final |- !Result !Rank !Result !Rank |- |Mahdi Afri |Men's 400m T12 | | | | |- |El Amin Chentouf |Men's marathon T12 |colspan=2 | | |- |Abdelhadi El Harti |Men's marathon T46 |colspan=2 | | |- |Abdeslam Hili |Men's 400m T12 | | | |- |Nabil Rahhali Omari |Men's 400m T12 | | | | |- |Ayoub Sadni |Men's 400m T47 | | | | |} ;Women's track {|class=wikitable style="font-size:95%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heats !colspan="3"|Final |- !Result !Rank !Result !Rank |- |Meryem An-Nourhi |Women's marathon T12 |colspan=2 | | |- |Fatima Ezzahra El Idrissi |Women's 1500m T13 | | | | |} ;Women's field {|class=wikitable style="font-size:95%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="3"|Final |- !Result !Points !Rank |- |Saida Amoudi |Women's shot put F34 | | | |- |Hayat El Garaa |Women's discus throw F41 | | | |- |Fouzia El Kassioui |Women's shot put F33 | | | |- |rowspan=2|Youssra Karim |Women's discus throw F41 | | | |- |Women's shot put F41 | | | |} ==See also== * Morocco at the Paralympics * Morocco at the 2020 Summer Olympics ==References== Category:Nations at the 2020 Summer Paralympics Category:Morocco at the Paralympics Category:2020 in Moroccan sport
title: Morocco at the 2020 Summer Paralympics
